item.title: Code
item.description: This webpage: Github Repo. Post. My Github repos.

item.title: Muzeeb Shaik
item.description: I am a second year PhD student in the Marketing Department at the Mays Business School at Texas A&M University. My broad research interests are in the area of Emprical Marketing Strategy. Specifically, I am interested in bussines-to-bussiness (B2B) markets. I am co-advised by Hari Sridhar (Texas A&M University) and Vikas Mittal (Rice University). My full CV is available here. Contact Email: mshaik [AT] mays [DOT] tamu [DOT] edu.

item.title: Research
item.description: Interests My broad interests are in the area of Emprical Marketing Strategy. Specifically, I am interested in bussines-to-bussiness (B2B) markets. Working Papers “Price Sensitivity and Customer Perceived Switching Costs in Business-to-Business Markets: Joint Effect on Customer Repurchase Intentions.” Joint work with Narendra Bosukonda, Vikas Mittal & Shrihari Sridhar. SSRN “The Asymmetric Association of Customer Commitment and Behavioral Intentions in Business-to-Business Markets.” Joint work with Narendra Bosukonda, Vikas Mittal & Shrihari Sridhar.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Texas A&M University Instructor: Marketing Analytics (Undergraduate) Fall 2020 (scheduled) Teaching Assistant: Marketing Management (MBA) Fall 2019 Texas Tech University Teaching Assistant: Engineering Economic Analysis (IE2324) Spring 2015, Fall 2015 and Spring 2016
